intro: Paepalanthus macer, commonly known as the desert buttercup, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and produces yellow flowers with a distinctive cup-shaped structure. The plant has small, linear leaves and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. It is often found in sandy soils and can tolerate high temperatures and limited water availability. Paepalanthus macer plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small desert organisms.
